bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

div1.p: Territory of Wash. vs. S.P. White } Brent Precinct. W.T. Jan. 5th 1885 In the matter of Territory versus S.P. White said S.P. White was arrested on a warrant issued by the coroner upon a verdict of said Coroners Jury which commenced on 25th day of Dec. 1884. S.P. White for plaintiff defendant and at the request of the undersigned J.H. Friedlander assisted in trying said case could for defendant ask for a continuance on the grounds that he was with a lawyer and had no time to get one. The justice decided that it was with a sufficient excuse as there lasted 15 days and that said to say was to me sufficient. defendant then waived an examination on the same grounds not granted then filed an afidavit for a change of venue no cause being sworn the trial concluded and justice claimed that he had no jurisdiction only as a committing magistrate.

The following witness were duly sworn and examined are: H. Portch, E. A. Portch, S. T. Beardon, John Jump, Frank Beardon, O. J. Rodgers, R. C. Welch G.M. Sherman, N. R. Williams and Wm Rhodes. The evidence being all in the testimony of the court in that said S. P. White is guilty of the offence of causing the death of H. L. Beardon and in therefore commanded him to jail to await the action of the stand jury. J. W. C. Justice of the Peace
Filed April 1885 Kate W. Feauerbach Clerk By R. Strobach
